serinfo.issue: 2008 World, Europe, United States, Canada, and Mexico

descript.abstract:
World Universal Transverse Mercator (UTM) Zones is a polygon theme representing the Universal Transverse Mercator (UTM) Zones of the world.
This dataset is a part of the 2008 ESRI Data and Maps Collection.
descript.purpose: World Universal Transverse Mercator (UTM) Zones provides the zones and the latitude and longitude values that are used to project each six-degree-wide zone according to the UTM projection.

cntinfo.cntinst:

For other questions or comments, you may contact ESRI headquarters by e-mail, telephone, or fax or write to us.

idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 2; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.0.1746

dataqual.logic: The shapefile is converted to SDC (Smart Data Compression) format using either ESRI SDC Data Development Kit Professional 2 (DDKP2) or tools in ArcGIS. The SDC data set is then loaded into ArcSDE to verify and validate the geometry.
dataqual.complete: After processing, the data set is checked for drawing display and number of records and file sizes compared with source materials.

horizpa.horizpar: The horizontal positional accuracy is unknown.

citeinfo.title: ArcData Online GIS Data on the Web World UTM Zones Data Set
citeinfo.othercit: This data set is also distributed in ArcWorld Supplement from ESRI.

citeinfo.title: GIS MGRS Grid Data layers in GIS Format
citeinfo.othercit: Downloaded: MGRS Grid Zone Designators (6x 8) (file size 1 MB) Shapefiles of the 6x 8 zones.

procstep.procdesc: The UTM zone index was mathematically generated by ESRI using ARC/INFO software. The zone definitions were obtained from "An Album of Map Projections: A Working Manual" by John P. Snyder (1987: USGS Professional Paper 1395. U.S. Government Printing Office: Washington, D.C.).

The following steps were performed by ESRI: Downloaded the ArcView GIS Shapefile, utm_zone.zip, from http://www.esri.com/data/online/esri/datapacks/utm_zone.html and extracted it. Chose UTM Areas (utm_ply.shp) and added attributes East_value, Cm_value, and West_value from UTM zones (zone.shp). Added filler values to attributes of the polygons in the north and south polar areas. Removed unneeded attributes. Created ArcGIS layer file (.lyr). Created projection file (.prj). Ran ArcView GIS Avenue request ExportClean, and created spatial indices. Converted the data set to SDC.
The following steps were performed by ESRI: Dissolved out the central meridian of each UTM zone/row cell, reducing the number of polygons by about half.
The following steps were performed by ESRI: The EAST_VALUE and WEST_VALUE attributes and their values were reversed, so the attribute names were swapped instead of the values.
The following steps were performed by ESRI: Corrected the east, north, and south geographic extents. Converted the data set to SDC.

The following steps were performed by ESRI: Adjusted UTM grid cells to fit two newly sized areas in Norway and Svalbard. The three original cells (32X, 34X, and 36X) no longer exist, having been absorbed by their adjacent cells in the row. The cell 32V absorbed the eastern half of cell 31V. Edited attributes WEST_VALUE, CM_VALUE, and EAST_VALUE for the affected grid cells. Converted the data set to SDC. Created ArcGIS layer file (.lyr), projection file (.prj), and spatial indices.

geodetic.horizdn: This data set was mathematically generated. You can define or use it unchanged with data based on any datum.

enttyp.enttypd: The polygons represent the Universal Transverse Mercator (UTM) Zones, which, lie between 84 degrees north and 80 degrees south latitude. With few exceptions, they divide the world into sixty zones, each of which is six degrees of longitude wide. The zones are numbered from 1 through 60 eastward from 180 degrees longitude. The zone characters designate eight degrees of latitude high rows extending north and south from the equator with the exception of the northern-most row which is 12 degrees high.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: The number of the UTM zone.

edom.edomvd: Filler value for north and south polar areas.

attr.attrdef: The character or designator of the UTM zone.

edom.edomv: C, D, E, F, G, H, J, K, L, M, N, P, Q, R, S, T, U, V, W, X

edom.edomvd: Filler values for north and south polar areas.

attr.attrdef: The longitude of the meridian forming the western border of the UTM zone.

edom.edomv: 180W incremented by -/+6 through 174E (with the exception of zones: 33X, 35X, 37X, and 32V)
edom.edomvd: The longitude of the meridian forming the western border of a UTM zone.
Filler value for north and south polar areas.

attr.attrdef: The longitude of the central meridian of the UTM zone.

edom.edomv: 177W incremented by -/+6 through 177E (with the exception of zones: 31X, 33X, 35X, 37X, 31V, and 32V)
edom.edomvd: The longitude of the central meridian of a UTM zone.
Filler value for north and south polar areas.

attr.attrdef: The longitude of the meridian forming the eastern border of the UTM zone.

edom.edomv: 174W incremented by -/+6 through 180E (with the exception of zones: 31X, 33X, 35X, and 31V)
edom.edomvd: The longitude of the meridian forming the eastern border of a UTM zone.
Filler value for north and south polar areas.
